page.title: 07Unemployment in Viewpark
page.content: In the Viewpark area there are 1,810 unemployed, a high percentage of the population. Many young people join a Youth Training Scheme but not many find a job afterwards. One local scheme (ITEC) trains youngsters to use comput- ers and many do find work after it. The unemployment rate has gone up in the last few years. The police say that there is also more vandalism and house-breaking in the area. Thieves mostly go for video-recorders or TV's. The unemployed can use their UB 40 card to use the baths in Bellshill free. Many go to the library. Most days you can see groups of youngsters hanging about the streets or the local 'Glen' with nothing to do. Many pupils in our school have someone in their family who is unemployed.
